channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NM

item.title: Report X-2023081362
item.description:
Report X-2023081362

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED AND SENT TO THE ORANGE BELT. THE ORANGE BELT SUPERVISOR NOTICED A WET SPOT ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE PACAKGE. THE BELT WAS STOPPED AND THE RESPONDER CALLED. RESPONDER DETERMINED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING INTERNALLY AND BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP. IT WAS DETERMINED THE BATTERY WAS LEAKING. RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE INTERNAL PACKAGING WAS FORMED FOAM AND A PLASTIC BAG WITH A ZIP TIE. THE ACID HAD LEAKED THROUGH THE PLASTIC BAG.

item.title: Report X-2023081125
item.description:
Report X-2023081125

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: SANTA TERESA
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered wet/leaking by driver. They then coded the package as (inspection required) once discovered. Then package was brought back to the station for further inspection. DescribePack: After inspection, the cause of the leak/spillage was a loose cap on the gallon bottle. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated from other packages and brought back to the facility for QA inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023081107
item.description:
Report X-2023081107

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded from trailer when package handler noticed package was leaking powder. Managment then placed package in plastic bin to prevent further spill and brought the package to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Package was punctured on the side of the box. During inspection of inner plastic bucket, there was a punctured hole as well on the bucket. When moved, the bucket would leak out powder. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After the discovery of the puncture was found, the bucket was placed back inside original packaging and then placed a salvage drum to prevent further leaking.

item.title: Report X-2023081102
item.description:
Report X-2023081102

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: SANTA TERESA
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered by driver on route at around 2:33 P.M. He noticed the outer package was wet and decided to bring it back for further inspection. Upon further inspection, we noticed the cap was loose on the gallon and there was spillage inside the bag leaking through to the box. We used proper safety precautions while cleaning and investigating the damage. DescribePack: Cap on top of the Gallon was loose. There was clear spillage inside the package and a strong odor. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was not delivered and brought back to terminal for further inspection.
